acras mór a great hunger –
Bha Calum sgìth a’ coiseachd air a’ mhonadh, ach mu dheireadh ràinig e mullach na beinne. Bha càrn chlach air mullach na beinne. Chuir Calum clach air a’ chàrn agus shuidh e ri taobh a’ chùirn a’ leigeil analach. [...] An ceann greise dh’éirich Calum ’na sheasamh agus thearnaich e a’ bheinn air a shocair. Chòrd an latha gu math ris ach bha an t-acras mór air nuair a ràinig e an taigh.
Malcolm was tired walking on the moor, but at last he reached the top of the mountain. There was a cairn of stones on the top of the mountain. Calum put a stone onto the cairn and he sat down beside the cairn having a rest. [...] After a while Malcolm rose up and he descended the mountain leisurely. He enjoyed the day well but he was very hungry when he reached the house. td. 146

acras agus biadh hunger and food –
Bha Màiri agus Seumas anns a’ mhonadh an dé. Thug Seumas leis an t-slat-iasgaich agus thug Màiri leatha biadh ann am bascaid. [...] Nuair a bha an t-acras orra, shuidh iad air tolman agus ghabh iad am biadh a bha aig Màiri anns a’ bhascaid.
Mary and James were on the moor yesterday. James took the fishing rod with him and Mary took (with her) food in a basket. [...] When they were hungry, they sat down on a hillock and they took the food that Mary had in the basket. td. 76
